pros: Fits true to size; Grip is great in dry conditions; Secure lacing and lockdown; Responsive; Excellent heel-loop; Durable construction; Air Zoom unit makes a difference; Great ground feel; Amazing colorways
cons: Tight in the toe box; Not enough cushioning for longer runs; Lack of grip on wet trails; Not much protection underfoot; Could be lighter
RR_verdict: I noticed that the sixth version of the Nike Terra Kiger doesn’t try to change hugely from the Terra Kiger 5, except in a few ways. The fastest trail shoe from Nike, the Terra Kiger 6 feels lower to the ground, and more form-fitting than its ancestor, making it better for those race days, but less capable of taking me long distances in my runs.
